benchmark_details.name: METATOOL
benchmark_details.overview: METATOOL is a benchmark designed to evaluate whether large language models (LLMs) possess tool usage awareness and can correctly choose tools. It includes a dataset called TOOLE, which contains diverse user queries requiring tool utilization, addressing both single-tool and multi-tool scenarios.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate LLMs based on their tool usage awareness and tool selection capabilities.

data.source: User queries generated using various prompting methods and curated through manual validation.

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated based on LLM responses to the benchmark tasks using defined ground truths.
methodology.interpretation: Metrics are interpreted based on performance comparisons of LLMs against expected outcomes on the benchmark tasks.
methodology.validation: Performance of LLMs was validated through extensive testing across eight popular models.
